physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Visual acuity was 20/50 in the right eye, with optic nerve pallor, retinal pigment epithelium granularity in the macula, macular epiretinal membrane, and choroidal folds in the inferior macula.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The ophthalmic examination and MRI remained unchanged upon follow-up in 1997. In 1998, her visual field defects slightly worsened.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Visual acuity was 20/30 in both eyes with multiple retinal capillary hemangiomas and area of subretinal fluid in the right eye.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: MRI revealed an increase in size of the mass with mild compression of the left temporal region of the optic chiasm. The tumor was excised completely, and postoperatively visual acuity improved to 20/20 bilaterally.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Visual acuity was 20/20 in both eyes; routine MRI showed a 7 mm mass of the intracanalicular portion of the left optic nerve with mild edema of the optic chiasm.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: In January 2007, his vision declined to counting fingers in the left eye; MRI revealed that the optic nerve tumor was unchanged in size, but the chiasmal edema had increased.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Visual acuity was 20/20 in both eyes. Fundus examination revealed a retinal capillary hemangioblastoma on the optic disc of the right eye.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperative follow-up at 5 months showed visual acuities of 20/15 in the right eye and 20/20 in the left eye, with a temporal visual field defect in the left eye.
